012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
015import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
016import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLActions;
017
018import org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation.ConditionalDDR; // for javadoc
019
020/**
021 * Exercise new mappings between date/time types and java.time classes
022 * (JDBC 4.2 change 21).
023 *<p>
024 * Defines a method {@link #javaSpecificationGE javaSpecificationGE} that may be
025 * of use for other examples.
026 *<p>
027 * Relies on PostgreSQL-version-specific implementor tags set up in the
028 * {@link ConditionalDDR} example.
029 */
030@SQLActions({
031    @SQLAction(
032        implementor="postgresql_ge_90300",requires="TypeRoundTripper.roundTrip",
033        install={
034        " SELECT" +
035        "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
036        "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'java.time.LocalDate passes')" +
037        "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'java.time.LocalDate fails')" +
038        "  END" +
039        " FROM" +
040        "  (VALUES" +
041        "   (date '2017-08-21')," +
042        "   (date '1970-03-07')," +
043        "   (date '1919-05-29')" +
044        "  ) AS p(orig)," +
045        "  javatest.roundtrip(p, 'java.time.LocalDate')" +
046        "  AS r(roundtripped date)",
047
048        " SELECT" +
049        "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
050        "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'java.time.LocalTime passes')" +
051        "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'java.time.LocalTime fails')" +
052        "  END" +
053        " FROM" +
054        "  (SELECT current_time::time) AS p(orig)," +
055        "  javatest.roundtrip(p, 'java.time.LocalTime')" +
056        "  AS r(roundtripped time)",
057
058        " SELECT" +
059        "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
060        "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'java.time.OffsetTime passes')" +
061        "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'java.time.OffsetTime fails')" +
062        "  END" +
063        " FROM" +
064        "  (SELECT current_time::timetz) AS p(orig)," +
065        "  javatest.roundtrip(p, 'java.time.OffsetTime')" +
066        "  AS r(roundtripped timetz)",
067
068        " SELECT" +
069        "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
070        "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'java.time.LocalDateTime passes')" +
071        "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING','java.time.LocalDateTime fails')"+
072        "  END" +
073        " FROM" +
074        "  (SELECT 'on' = current_setting('integer_datetimes')) AS ck(idt)," +
075        "  LATERAL (" +
076        "   SELECT" +
077        "    value" +
078        "   FROM" +
079        "    (VALUES" +
080        "     (true, timestamp '2017-08-21 18:25:29.900005')," +
081        "     (true, timestamp '1970-03-07 17:37:49.300009')," +
082        "     (true, timestamp '1919-05-29 13:08:33.600001')," +
083        "     (idt,  timestamp  'infinity')," +
084        "     (idt,  timestamp '-infinity')" +
085        "    ) AS vs(cond, value)" +
086        "   WHERE cond" +
087        "  ) AS p(orig)," +
088        "  javatest.roundtrip(p, 'java.time.LocalDateTime')" +
089        "  AS r(roundtripped timestamp)",
090
091        " SELECT" +
092        "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
093        "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'java.time.OffsetDateTime passes')"+
094        "  ELSE javatest.logmessage(" +
095        "         'WARNING','java.time.OffsetDateTime fails')"+
096        "  END" +
097        " FROM" +
098        "  (SELECT 'on' = current_setting('integer_datetimes')) AS ck(idt)," +
099        "  LATERAL (" +
100        "   SELECT" +
101        "    value" +
102        "   FROM" +
103        "    (VALUES" +
104        "     (true, timestamptz '2017-08-21 18:25:29.900005Z')," +
105        "     (true, timestamptz '1970-03-07 17:37:49.300009Z')," +
106        "     (true, timestamptz '1919-05-29 13:08:33.600001Z')," +
107        "     (idt,  timestamptz  'infinity')," +
108        "     (idt,  timestamptz '-infinity')" +
109        "    ) AS vs(cond, value)" +
110        "   WHERE cond" +
111        "  ) AS p(orig)," +
112        "  javatest.roundtrip(p, 'java.time.OffsetDateTime')" +
113        "  AS r(roundtripped timestamptz)",
114
115        " SELECT" +
116        "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
117        "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'OffsetTime as stmt param passes')"+
118        "  ELSE javatest.logmessage(" +
119        "         'WARNING','java.time.OffsetTime as stmt param fails')"+
120        "  END" +
121        " FROM" +
122        "  (SELECT current_time::timetz) AS p(orig)," +
123        "  javatest.roundtrip(p, 'java.time.OffsetTime', true)" +
124        "  AS r(roundtripped timetz)"
125    })
126})
127public class JDBC42_21
128{
129    /**
130     * Return true if running under a Java specification version at least as
131     * recent as the argument ('1.6', '1.7', '1.8', '9', '10', '11', ...).
132     */
133    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="javaSpecificationGE")
134    public static boolean javaSpecificationGE(String want)
135    {
136        String got = System.getProperty("java.specification.version");
137        if ( want.startsWith("1.") )
138            want = want.substring(2);
139        if ( got.startsWith("1.") )
140            got = got.substring(2);
141        return 0 <= Integer.valueOf(got).compareTo(Integer.valueOf(want));
142    }
143}
